gf-3.6.10: Grammatical Framework

MaintainerKrasimir Angelov
Stabilitystable
Portabilityportable

PGF2

  • Exceptions
  • Grammar specific callbacks

Description

This is the Haskell binding to the C run-time system for loading and interpreting grammars compiled in Portable Grammar Format (PGF).

Synopsis

  • type CId = String
  • data PGF
  • readPGF :: FilePath -> IO PGF
  • type AbsName = String
  • abstractName :: PGF -> AbsName
  • startCat :: PGF -> Cat
  • type ConcName = String
  • data Concr
  • languages :: PGF -> Map ConcName Concr
  • parse :: Concr -> Cat -> String -> Either String [(Expr, Float)]
  • parseWithHeuristics :: Concr -> Cat -> String -> Double -> [(Cat, Int -> String -> Int -> Maybe (Expr, Float, Int))] -> Either String [(Expr, Float)]
  • hasLinearization :: Concr -> Fun -> Bool
  • linearize :: Concr -> Expr -> String
  • alignWords :: Concr -> Expr -> [(String, [Int])]

  • type Hypo = (BindType, CId, Type)
  • functionType :: PGF -> CId -> Type

  • type Fun = String
  • readExpr :: String -> Maybe Expr
  • showExpr :: Expr -> String
  • mkApp :: Fun -> [Expr] -> Expr
  • unApp :: Expr -> Maybe (Fun, [Expr])
  • mkStr :: String -> Expr

  • fullFormLexicon :: Concr -> [(String, [MorphoAnalysis])]

  • type LiteralCallback = PGF -> (ConcName, Concr) -> Int -> String -> Int -> Maybe (Expr, Float, Int)

Concrete syntax

type ConcName

Arguments

 = String

Name of concrete syntax

data Concr

languages :: PGF -> Map ConcName Concr

parse :: Concr -> Cat -> String -> Either String [(Expr, Float)]

parseWithHeuristics

Arguments

:: Concr

the language with which we parse

-> Cat

the start category

-> String

the input sentence

-> Double

the heuristic factor. A negative value tells the parser to lookup up the default from the grammar flags

-> [(Cat, Int -> String -> Int -> Maybe (Expr, Float, Int))]

a list of callbacks for literal categories. The arguments of the callback are: the index of the constituent for the literal category; the input sentence; the current offset in the sentence. If a literal has been recognized then the output should be Just (expr,probability,end_offset)

-> Either String [(Expr, Float)] 

hasLinearization :: Concr -> Fun -> Bool

linearize :: Concr -> Expr -> String

alignWords :: Concr -> Expr -> [(String, [Int])]

Types

data Type

DTyp [Hypo] CId [Expr] 

Instances

Show Type 

type Hypo = (BindType, CId, Type)

Hypo represents a hypothesis in a type i.e. in the type A -> B, A is the hypothesis

functionType :: PGF -> CId -> Type
